Canonicalize expressions that contain a negative floating-point constant of the following form: OtherOp + (subtree) -&gt; OtherOp &#123;+/-&#125; (canonical subtree) (subtree) + OtherOp -&gt; OtherOp &#123;+/-&#125; (canonical subtree) OtherOp - (subtree) -&gt; OtherOp &#123;+/-&#125; (canonical subtree) <a href="#a812a502221b5de67dc5f203bc5cc4e2c">More...</a>

Given an fadd/fsub with an operand that is a one-use instruction (the fadd/fsub), try to change negative floating-point constants into positive constants to increase potential for reassociation and CSE. <a href="#a53bae3c124b8b14d2564e5a91682a99e">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

## Description {#details}

Reassociate commutative expressions.

## Private Member Functions

### buildMinimalMultiplyDAG() {#a097c387488651dfb5537182144ed8cc9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Value &#42; ReassociatePass::buildMinimalMultiplyDAG (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilderbase">IRBuilderBase</a> &amp; Builder, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/reassociate/factor">reassociate::Factor</a> &gt; &amp; Factors)</>}>
Build a minimal multiplication DAG for (a^x)&#42;(b^y)&#42;(c^z)&#42;...

Given a vector of values raised to various powers, where no two values are equal and the powers are sorted in decreasing order, compute the minimal DAG of multiplies to compute the final product, and return that product value.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/scalar/reassociate-h/#l00132">132</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/scalar/reassociate-h">Reassociate.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/reassociate-cpp/#l01805">1805</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/reassociate-cpp">Reassociate.cpp</a>.

### canonicalizeNegFPConstants() {#a812a502221b5de67dc5f203bc5cc4e2c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Instruction &#42; ReassociatePass::canonicalizeNegFPConstants (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; I)</>}>
Canonicalize expressions that contain a negative floating-point constant of the following form: OtherOp + (subtree) -&gt; OtherOp &#123;+/-&#125; (canonical subtree) (subtree) + OtherOp -&gt; OtherOp &#123;+/-&#125; (canonical subtree) OtherOp - (subtree) -&gt; OtherOp &#123;+/-&#125; (canonical subtree)

The fadd/fsub opcode may be switched to allow folding a negation into the input instruction.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/scalar/reassociate-h/#l00142">142</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/scalar/reassociate-h">Reassociate.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/reassociate-cpp/#l02126">2126</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/reassociate-cpp">Reassociate.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Given an fadd/fsub with an operand that is a one-use instruction (the fadd/fsub), try to change negative floating-point constants into positive constants to increase potential for reassociation and CSE.

### OptimizeAdd() {#a0892d06daf168d9ee5dc27620836c889}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Value &#42; ReassociatePass::OptimizeAdd (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; I, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/reassociate/valueentry">reassociate::ValueEntry</a> &gt; &amp; Ops)</>}>
Optimize a series of operands to an &#39;add&#39; instruction.

This optimizes based on identities. If it can be reduced to a single <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a>, it is returned, otherwise the Ops list is mutated as necessary.
